sen.j: 司（つかさ/し）は日本古代の律令制において主に省のもとに置かれた官司の等級の一つである。
sen.e: Tsukasa (also known as Shi) was a rank of government offices mainly placed under the ministries in the ancient Japanese ritsuryo legal code system.
Tsukasa (also known as Shi) was a rank in government offices mainly placed under the ministries in the ancient Japanese ritsuryo legal code system.
sen.cmt: a rank of government offices --> a rank in government offices
sen.e: Tsukasa (also known as Shi) was a rank in government offices mainly placed under the ministries in the ancient Japanese ritsuryo legal code system.

sen.j: 職 (律令制)や寮 (律令制)と並び主に省（中務省・治部省・刑部省・兵部省・大蔵省・宮内省の各省）や衛門府・京職のもとに置かれて事務を行った。
sen.e: Along with Shiki (ritsuryo system) and Tsukasa (also known as Ryo) (ritsuryo system), Tsukasa was mainly placed under the ministries (Nakatsukasasho, Jibusho, Gyobusho, Hyobusho, Okurasho, and Kunaisho), Emonfu, and Kyoshiki to be in charge of clerical work.

Along with Shiki (ritsuryo system) and Ryo (ritsuryo system), Tsukasa was mainly placed under the ministries (Nakatsukasasho, Jibusho, Gyobusho, Hyobusho, Okurasho, and Kunaisho), Emonfu, and Kyoshiki to be in charge of clerical work.

Along with Shiki (ritsuryo system) and Ryo (ritsuryo system), Tsukasa was mainly placed under the ministries (Nakatsukasasho, Jibusho, Gyobusho, Hyobusho, Okurasho, and Kunaisho), Emonfu, and Kyoshiki to be in charge of clerical work.

sen.j: 前二者との違いは基本職員である四等官の数の違いにある。
sen.e: Tsukasa was different from the other two in the number of Shitokan, the regular officials.
Tsukasa was different from the other two in the number of Shitokan, the regular officials.
Tsukasa was different from the other two in the number of Shitokan, the regular officials.

sen.j: 通常四等官は長官・次官・判官・主典の四者から構成されるが､司の場合は基本的に次官が欠けている。
sen.e: Usually, the ranks of Shitokan consisted of Kami, Suke, Jo, and Sakan but Tsukasa did not have Suke in general.
Usually, Shitokan consisted of Kami, Suke, Jo, and Sakan but Tsukasa did not have Suke in general.
Usually, Shitokan consisted of Kami, Suke, Jo, and Sakan but Tsukasa did not have Suke in general.

sen.j: また､前二者が省との間はある程度の独立関係であるのに対し､こちらはほぼ完全に省など上級機関の統制下に置かれている。
sen.e: While Shiki and Tsukasa (or Ryo) were independent of the ministries to some extent, Tsukasa was mostly under the command of the higher organizations including the ministries.
While Shiki and Ryo were independent of the ministries to some extent, Tsukasa was mostly under the command of the higher organizations including the ministries.
While Shiki and Ryo were independent of the ministries to some extent, Tsukasa was mostly under the command of the higher organizations including the ministries.

sen.j: 職・寮・司の中で最も格が低いため､現業部門が多く平安時代に大部分が整理・統合された。
sen.e: As Tsukasa were ranked lower than Shiki and Tsukasa (or Ryo), most of its branches were in charge of work-site operations, the most of which were consolidated during the Heian period.
As Tsukasa was ranked lower than Shiki and Ryo, it included a lot of branches in charge of work-site operations, most of which were consolidated during the Heian period.
As Tsukasa was ranked lower than Shiki and Ryo, it included a lot of branches in charge of work-site operations, most of which were consolidated during the Heian period.

sen.j: 内兵庫のように形式的に独立した司もある。
sen.e: Some Tsukasa like Uchinohyogo became independent in form.
Some Tsukasa like Uchinohyogo became independent in form.
Some Tsukasa like Uchinohyogo became independent in form.

sen.j: 基本的に「－司」と司の文字が後につくが内兵庫だけは普通つけない。
sen.e: In general, Tsukasa had the letter 司 added to its name like '- 司' but Uchinohyogo usually does not have that letter.
In general, Tsukasa had the letter 司 added to its name like '- 司' but Uchinohyogo usually did not have that letter.
sen.cmt: does not have --> did not have
sen.e: In general, Tsukasa had the letter 司 added to its name like '- 司' but Uchinohyogo usually did not have that letter.

sen.j: 春宮坊管下は監（げん）および署（しょ）と呼ばれる機関があるが､これも司の一種である。
sen.e: Organizations called Gen and Sho under the command of Togubo were also kinds of Tsukasa.
Organizations called Gen and Sho under the command of Togubo were also a kind of Tsukasa.
sen.cmt: kinds of Tsukasa --> a kind of Tsukasa
sen.e: Organizations called Gen and Sho under the command of Togubo were also a kind of Tsukasa.

sen.j: 司は職員の人数などによってさらに四等級に分けることができる。
sen.e: Tsukasa can be further divided into four ranks according to the number of officials.
Tsukasa can be further divided into four ranks according to the number of officials.
Tsukasa can be further divided into four ranks according to the number of officials.

sen.j: 大司四等官の構成は正（正六位上）-佑（従七位下）-大令史（大初位上）-少令史（大初位下）
sen.e: Shitokan of Otsukasa were Kami (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) - Daisakan (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade) - Shosakan (Greater Initial lRank, Lower Grade.)

Shitokan of Otsukasa included Kami (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) - Daisakan (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade) - Shosakan (Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)

Shitokan of Otsukasa included Kami (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) - Daisakan (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade) - Shosakan (Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)

sen.j: 中司四等官の構成は正（正六位下）-佑（正八位上）-令史（大初位下）
sen.e: Shitokan of Nakatsukasa were Kami (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Jo (Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) - Sakan (Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)
Shitokan of Nakatsukasa included Kami (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Jo (Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) - Sakan (Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)
Shitokan of Nakatsukasa included Kami (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Jo (Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) - Sakan (Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)

sen.j: 小司・監四等官の構成は正（従六位上）-佑（正八位下）-令史（少初位上）
sen.e: Shitokan of Shotsukasa and Gen were Kami (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Sakan (Lesser Initial Rank, Upper Grade.)
Shitokan of Shotsukasa and Gen included Kami (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Sakan (Lesser Initial Rank, Upper Grade.)
Shitokan of Shotsukasa and Gen included Kami (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Sakan (Lesser Initial Rank, Upper Grade.)

sen.j: 下司・署四等官の構成は正・首（従六位下）-令史（少初位下）
sen.e: Shitokan of Shotsukasa and Sho were Kami (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Sakan (Lesser Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)
Shitokan of Shotsukasa and Sho included Kami (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Sakan (Lesser Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)
Shitokan of Shotsukasa and Sho included Kami (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Sakan (Lesser Initial Rank, Lower Grade.)

sen.j: 斎院司(官位が他より高く四等官の名称も異なる)
sen.e: Saiinshi (has higher court rank than the others and different names for Shitokan from the others.)
Saiinshi (having a higher court rank than the others and different names of Shitokan from the others.)
Saiinshi (having a higher court rank than the others and different names of Shitokan from the others.)

sen.j: ※内膳司の長官は奉膳と称し2名いた。
sen.e: * Naizenshi had two Kami called Buzen.
* Naizenshi had two Kami called Buzen.
* Naizenshi had two Kami called Buzen.

sen.j: また次官として典膳（6名）が存在していた。
sen.e: It had six Tenzen as Suke.
It had six Tenzen as Suke.
It had six Tenzen as Suke.

sen.j: これらは令制以前からの伝統による。
sen.e: These were traditions handed down from before the introduction of the ritsuryo system.
These were traditions handed down from before the introduction of the ritsuryo system.
These were traditions handed down from before the introduction of the ritsuryo system.
